name: kefta mkaouara
ingredients: 1 handful of chopped parsley and cilantro
For the meatballs (Kefta): 400g of ground meat, 1/2 tsp of pepper, 1/2 tsp of ginger, 1 tsp of paprika, 1 tsp of cumin, 1 tsp of salt, 1 tbsp of chopped parsley and cilantro, 1 grated garlic clove
steps: Prepare the sauce: In the tagine/pan, grate the onion, tomatoes, and garlic cloves.
Add the chopped parsley and cilantro, pepper, ginger, paprika, cumin, and salt. Add the olive oil. Cook the sauce for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Prepare the meatballs: In a bowl, mix the ground meat with the spices (pepper, ginger, paprika, cumin, salt), parsley/cilantro, and grated garlic. Form into meatballs.
Add the meatballs to the tomato sauce. Cover and cook for 15 minutes.
Crack the 4 eggs over the meatballs (make wells in the sauce). Cover and cook for an additional 5 minutes (or until the eggs are cooked to your liking).
